tool.name: rdeval
tool.description: Multithreaded read analysis and manipulation tool.
tool.command:
rdeval #for $file in $input_reads: --input-reads '$file' #end for
#if $expected_gsize $expected_gsize #end if
#if $filter_list.list_selector == "exclude_list" --exclude-list '$exclude_list' #else if $filter_list.list_selector == "include_list" --include-list '$include_list' #end if --filter '$filter' --quality '$quality' --out-size '$out_size' #if $homopolymers.compress_selector == "yes" --homopolymer-compress '$homopolymer_compress' #end if --sample '$sample' #if $random.seed_selector == "yes" --random-seed '$random_seed' #end if #if $sequence_report --sequence-report #end if #if $md5 --md5 #end if #if $verbose --verbose #end if #if $cmd --cmd #end if --tabular --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-2} --out-format '$output_format'

param.name: list_selector
param.label: Use and exclude or include file
quality type
param.option: Both length and quality for each read

param.label: Compress homopolymers longer than n in the input

param.name: seed_selector
param.label: supply random seed to make subsampling reproducible
random seed to make subsampling reproducible
Generate a per-read report instead of a summary report

tool.help:
**rdeval** is a general-purpose, multithreaded tool for analyzing and manipulating reads (FASTA/FASTQ/BAM/CRAM/RD).
rdeval input.fa*[.gz]|bam|cram|rd [expected genome size]
::
Dataset report example:
+++Read summary+++: # reads: 10000 Total read length: 134014104 Average read length: 13401.41 Read N50: 14270 Smallest read length: 1142 Largest read length: 40910 Coverage: inf GC content %: 43.78 Base composition (A:C:T:G): 37693226:29331833:37655925:29333120 Average per base quality: 26.47
::
Per sequence/read report (--sequence-report) example:
Header Comment Length A C G T N GC Average Quality m54306U_210528_154706/69206614/ccs 22812 6170 5146 4802 6694 0 0.44 89.9705 m54306U_210528_154706/25888573/ccs 32200 9162 7270 7112 8656 0 0.45 56.8306 m54306U_210528_154706/40634168/ccs 8487 2443 1858 1876 2310 0 0.44 90.3828 m54306U_210528_154706/103745617/ccs 16496 4546 3752 3760 4438 0 0.46 88.3554
::
Options: --sequence-report generates a per-read report -e --exclude-list <file> generates output on a excluding list of headers. -f --filter <exp> filter reads using <exp> in quotes, e.g. 'l>10' for longer than 10bp or 'l>10 & q>10' to further exclude reads by quality (default: none). -i --include-list <file> generates output on a subset list of headers. -o --out-format <file> output file (fa*[.gz], bam, cram, rd). Optionally write reads to file or generate rd summary file. -q --quality q|a generates list of average quality for each read (q) or both length and quality (a). -r --input-reads <file1> <file2> <file n> input file (fa*[.gz], bam, cram, rd). -s --out-size u|s|h|c generates size list (unsorted|sorted|histogram|inverse cumulative table). --homopolymer-compress <int> compress all the homopolymers longer than n in the input. --sample <float> fraction of reads to subsample. --random-seed <int> an optional random seed to make subsampling reproducible. --md5 print md5 of .rd files. --tabular tabular output. --verbose verbose output. -j --threads <int> numbers of threads (default:5). -v --version software version. --cmd print $0 to stdout.
